p: The wound healing process encompasses four highly integrated and overlapping phases: hemostasis, inflammation, proliferation, and tissue remodeling [ 1]. The molecular complexity of the wound repair process stems from the fact that it is modulated by hundreds of genes involved in growth factor, pro-inflammatory cytokine and chemokine signaling [ 2]. The skin is now recognized as an endocrine organ, which can produce hormones, express different receptors and also modulate local cytokine production [ 3].
